Description: Several fragments of three different kinds of string that were used together as binding. One fragment has 3 knots. The string types consist of the following: dark brown/black string, made of human hair, consisting of 2 and 3 's'-spun elements that were 'z'-plied; white wool string, consisting of 3 's'-spun elements that were 'z'-plied; and brown and white wool string, consisting of 2 white 's'-spun and 1 brown 's'-spun elements, 'z'-plied together. The white wool string is tight and very fine.
Dimensions: Diameter: 1.50 millimetres (brown and white wool string)
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 64)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.108D (excavation object cat. no.)
